alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 15 at 3:30PM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Dense Fog This Afternoon in Northern Wisconsin... .Dangerous driving conditions are in place across northern Wisconsin with near zero visibility this afternoon in widespread dense fog. The dense fog could persist into the evening until a line of storms moves through. The advisory may need to be extended into the evening. ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, south winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility zero to one quarter mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 6 AM CST Thursday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Damaging winds tonight could blow down trees and power lines causing power outages, possibly for a prolonged period of time. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Empty semi-trailers will run the risk of being blown over.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
